Anti-"Government" Rally Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Rally Held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- At least 5,000 unionists affiliated to the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions had an anti-"government" rally in Seoul on Mar. 26 in protest against the "bill on the part-time job" introduced by the south Korean "government" and its negotiations for the conclusion of FTA with the U.S., according to the south Korean KBS. 
 They threatened to call a general strike from the next month if the "government" neither stops the above-said negotiations nor withdraws the bill at once.

articles.title: Halt to U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Maneuvers Demanded
articles.content:
Halt to U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Maneuvers Demanded 
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The World Federation of Trade Unions (WFTU) released a statement on March 25 to denounce the U.S. and the south Korean bellicose forces' joint military exercises RSOI and Foal Eagle.
 It is very clear that those large-scale military exercises are targeted on the DPRK, the statement noted, and continued: 
 The WFTU on behalf of the working class in the Asia-Pacific region bitterly denounces the on-going RSOI and Foal Eagle and strongly demands the U.S. and the south Korean authorities immediately stop working hard to start a war and laying an obstacle to Korea's reunification.    
 The Indian Institute for Foreign Policy Studies in a statement on Mar. 26 held that through these military exercises the U.S. seeks to instigate the south Korean bellicose forces to escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula in a bid to scuttle the six-party talks, bedevil the inter-Korean relations heading for reconciliation under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and block the independent reunification of Korea.
 It is entirely just for the Korean people to have built strong nuclear deterrent for self-defence to cope with the U.S. moves for a nuclear war, pursuant to the Songun politics of leader Kim Jong Il, the statement said, expressing positive support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle for national reunification.

articles.title: Friendly Gathering with Russian Embassy Officials Held
articles.content:
Friendly Gathering with Russian Embassy Officials Held 
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting between officials of the DPRK Foreign Ministry and staff members of the Russian embassy here took place on March 28 on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the signing of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
 Present there were officials of the DPRK Foreign Ministry and the ambassador and staff members of the Russian embassy.    
 The participants talked to each other about the matter of further developing the cooperative relations between the two countries in various fields and had sports and amusement games, deepening friendship.

Japanese Security Authorities Hit for Their Campaign against DPRK and Chongryon
articles.content:
Japanese Security Authorities Hit for Their Campaign against DPRK and Chongryon
    Pyongyang, March 29 (KCNA) -- The security department of the Tokyo Police Agency recently searched six places including the Office of the Osaka Prefectural Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, dwelling houses and shops of Koreans in Japan allegedly to investigate a Korean businessman who managed a restaurant and his "cooperators" as a person related to the "abduction case" worked there in June 1980.
 In this regard Minju Joson Wednesday in a signed commentary says: 
 The organizations of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan are economic organizations for protecting the right of business and vital rights of Korean traders and industrialists in Japan and supporting their management activities and, accordingly, they have nothing to do with such case as the "abduction issue".
 The forcible search is the product of a base plot to link the "abduction issue" with the Osaka Prefectural Korean federation to do harm to the DPRK and Chongryon (the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan).    
 As publicly recognized by the international community, the "abduction issue" has already been settled through the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration but the Japanese reactionaries are persistently raising the issue to use it as a means of slandering the DPRK and Chongryon.    
 The forcible search of the office and dwelling houses heralds that the Japanese reactionaries' smear campaign against the DPRK and Chongryon will be more ferocious. 
 The Korean people are not repressing their surging national resentment and enmity against the Japanese reactionaries keen on the smear campaign. 
 If they continue to resort to the smear campaign, they will be held wholly accountable for the grave consequences to be entailed by it.
